intro: Teucrium commune var. intermedium, commonly known as redstem germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense spikes and are typically pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
